The authors of the petition admitted that Wonder Woman’s creators may have intended her to be “a strong and independent warrior with a feminist message.”
But they whined that the 75-year-old fictional character was actually the “epitome of a pin-up girl.”
Citing Wonder Woman’s large breasts, curves, white skin, and skimpy clothes, the petitioners argued that the character was an overtly sexual image and wasn’t culturally encompassing or sensitive enough.
Wonder Woman’s appointment was protested by dozens of U.N. staffers back in October. Now it’s been confirmed that the haters have got their wish.
The U.N. refused to elaborate on why the Wonder Woman campaign was ending this week, even though it was scheduled to run well into 2017, according to Reuters.
D.C. Comics said it was proud of the character’s work with the U.N. to achieve gender equality and empower women and girls.
Wonder Woman will be back in June next year, when a feature-length movie starring Israeli actress Gal Gadot as the scantily clad superheroine is scheduled for release.
item.tags: video,Wonder woman,wonder woman un,wonder woman fired,wonder woman fired by un,wonder woman sexy,wonder woman reaction,gal gadot

item.title: Tapeworm extraction: Man gets disgusting 5-foot-long parasite pulled from nose
item.description:
AUSTRALIA — Hold on to your lunches, the latest viral video to come out of the internet is filled with blood, pain, and a person-sized parasite that’s so disgusting it’ll make you hurl.
Tapeworms often make themselves at home in a person’s gut, but this Aussie guy supposedly had one living up his nose, according to a video posted on LiveLeak.
His doctor helped take care of the problem, yanking the 5-foot-long worm for a good 30 seconds as the man squirmed in agony.
The horrifying video was of course uploaded online, where it’s no doubt made a lot of people sick.
Some netizens are skeptical though, pointing out odd things in the video that don’t just add up to a parasite scenario. They suggest that rather than having a parasitic pet, it seems more likely the man had a sinus problem he got fixed.
So instead of extracting an icky 5-foot wriggler, the doctor could have just been pulling out a bloody strip of gauze that was used during surgery.
In the end, it doesn’t really matter what that nasty thing is — still doesn’t make watching it get yanked out of a man’s face any less disgusting.
item.tags: video,Tapeworm extraction,nose tapeworm,tapeworm,tapeworm pulled from nose,parasite extraction,worm pulled from nose,5 foot long tapeworm

item.title: Kanye shows up late for concert then cancels it after rant about Beyonce and Jay Z - TomoNews
item.description:
SACRAMENTO, CALIFORNIA — Kanye West fans are livid after he showed up to a concert late and called it off after performing just two songs.
According to the Sacramento Bee, the artist was late by more than an hour for his concert on Saturday in California’s capital city.
When Kanye finally arrived, he performed the songs Famous and Father Stretch My Hands from his latest album Life of Pablo.
Then he launched into a 15-minute-long rant on various topics. Kanye claimed Beyonce conspired with MTV to win this year’s video of the year award. He also begged Jay Z not to kill him.
After the concert, it was announced that the rest of Kanye’s Saint Pablo tour had been called off. Attendees of the Sacramento concert have been offered refunds by Ticketmaster.
item.tags: video,Kanye,Kanye West,Yeezy,Kanye cancels concert,Kanye rant,Jay Z,Beyonce,Kanye angry,Kanye upset with Jay Z,Life of Pablo,Saint Pablo Tour,Kanye insane

item.title: Impaled by arrow: Dog shot in chest with 3-foot arrow rescued by Chinese animal shelter
item.description:
CHENGDU, CHINA — Photos of a dog who was shot in the chest with an arrow have gone viral on Chinese social media and drawn attention to the plight of stray dogs in the country.
As reported by the Chongqing Morning Post, a Chinese netizen identified only as Ren Hui spotted the dog at Yinxing Hospitality Management College in the city of Chengdu, in China’s Sichuan province.
Ren Hui posted photos of the injured animal on her Weibo account, along with a call for the public to help. Volunteers from the Sichuan Qiming Companion Animal Protection Center saw the post and found the dog. They removed the arrow, but the dog got scared and ran off.
It was later found and taken to Chengdu’s Boai Veterinary Hospital for medical treatment. Fortunately, the arrow did not damage its internal organs.
Photos of the dog with the arrow sticking through its chest sparked outrage on the Chinese internet.
In China, stray dogs are often shot with arrows and captured by dog catchers, Chen Yunlian, founder of Chengdu Animal Rescue, told the Shanghaiist.
In May, a stray dog with an arrow sticking out of its head was spotted in Beijing's 798 Art District. And in August, another stray dog that had been shot with an arrow was found in Wuhan. Both dogs were rescued and have been treated for their injuries, the Beijing News reported.
item.tags: video,Impaled by arrow,animal fails,impaled,shooting dogs,animal cruelty,animal abuse,impaled with arrow,dog shot,shooting arrows at dogs,dogs,China news 2016

item.title: Squirrel eats mouse: Hungry squirrel has fellow rodent over for lunch
item.description:
’MURICA — If you’re easily grossed out by the sight of Mother Nature in all of her raw and unadulterated glory, then perhaps it’s time to look away now.
But those of you who think the natural world is completely awesome should stay tuned in for this one.
Stunningly clear video footage has captured a hungry and determined squirrel chowing down on an unfortunate mouse.
And you thought squirrels were vegetarians.
Well, apparently not. So yes, while it’s true that squirrels love nuts, they’re not exactly what you’d call fussy eaters.
Although several varieties of the species are in fact herbivores that live on a plant-based diet, many squirrels are omnivores with an unequivocal taste for meat.
Some ground squirrels like nothing better than scarfing down on insects, worms and even small mice — something clearly demonstrated in this video.
item.tags: video,Squirrel,mouse,squirrel eats mouse,squirrel eating mouse,squirrel eating rat,rodent,gross animals,cannibal animals

item.title: Airport shooting: Suspect found dead after gunning down Southwest employee in Oklahoma - TomoNews
item.description:
OKLAHOMA CITY — Will Rogers World Airport in Oklahoma City was closed for most of Tuesday following a shooting that took the life of one Southwest Airlines employee.
KFOR reports that the 52-year-old shooting victim was identified as Michael Winchester, a former University of Oklahoma football player whose son plays for the Kansas City Chiefs.
Winchester was reportedly shot while walking near the airport parking garage shortly before 1 p.m. on Tuesday. He was found wounded and bleeding and brought to the hospital, where he later succumbed to his injuries.
Officers arrived at the scene and immediately put the airport on lockdown. Flights were suspended, vehicles barred from entering and leaving, and passengers told to seek cover.
Police armed with rifles searched the complex for the suspect, and later found him dead inside the parking garage hours later. His body was found in a red pickup truck. There was a gunshot wound to his head, which was believed to be self-inflicted, according to News9.
Authorities are still investigating the incident and have yet to disclose a motive for the killing, which some media outlets suggest was a premeditated act.
item.tags: video,Oklahoma airport shooting,oklahoma shooting,airport shooting,southwest employee shot,michael winchester,michael winchester shooting,will rogers airport shooting,airport gunman

item.title: Brain implant device allows ALS patient to communicate with brain activity without help - TomoNews
item.description:
UTRECHT, NETHERLANDS — Researchers in the Netherlands have developed a brain implant that enables a woman with Lou Gehrig’s disease, also known as ALS, to communicate using brain activity, and without a doctor’s supervision.
An electrocorticograph, developed by researchers at the University Medical Center Utrecht, consists of four electrode strips of about 5 cm long, with each holding four small electrodes. The electrode strips are implanted inside the skull against the brain.
According to the study published in the New England Journal of Medicine, two of the electrode strips are placed over the region of the left motor cortex that controls hand movements, and the other two are placed over the left prefrontal cortex as a backup. The electrode strips are connected to an transmitter device that is installed inside the left side of the patient’s chest. The implant wirelessly connects to a receiver via an antenna and to a tablet computer mounted on the wheelchair.
To activate the electrodes, the patient thinks about moving her right hand, which triggers the electrodes to send signals down to the transmitter in the chest. This eventually resulting in her hand moving a cursor to make an input on the computer screen. If the patient’s motor cortex degenerates over time, she would counter backwards to activate the backup electrodes placed over her prefrontal cortex, as this region is responsible for mental calculation.
ALS affects the neurons that are required for voluntary muscle control and causes complete paralysis within a couple of years. According to the ALS Association, about 6,000 people in the U.S. are diagnosed with ALS each year. There is no known cure to the disease.
item.tags: video,Lou Gehrig,ALS,paralysis,paralyzed,ALS patient video,ALS communication device,brain implant

item.title: Old ladies fight off carjacker from notorious Milwaukee carjacker ring
item.description:
MILWAUKEE — A couple of carjackers thought stealing from two old ladies would be a piece of cake, only to learn the hard way that it’s best not to underestimate the elderly, especially if they’re ex-military.
WISN reports that on Oct. 22, Miriam Ben-Shalom and her partner Karen Weiss pulled up to the valet stand of Hotel Metro in Milwaukee for a night of fine French dining.
But while Ben-Shalom was grabbing Weiss’ walker from the back of the car, a teen, later identified as 17-year-old Junior Moreno, attempted to steal the car. Unfortunately for him, ex-Army drill sergeant Ben-Shalom was not one to be trifled with.
She quickly tackled the carjacker to the ground, then stood up and threatened him with a boot to his privates.
While the teen was pinned down, Weiss pulled his hoodie back with her cane to ID his face. But before the police could arrive, a black Jeep Cherokee carrying the carjacker’s accomplices pulled up.
Jesus Lazaro was in the driver’s seat as 18-year-old Giovanni Zurfluh got out and threatened to shoot the women if they didn’t let their friend go. The hooligans managed to get away, but not before the retirees got hold of their license number.
The three suspects, who turned out to be members of the Cut Throat Mob carjacking ring, were apprehended in December, thanks to key information from the women.
The trio was allegedly involved in more than a dozen other thefts, and together is facing 31 felony charges.
item.tags: video,Old lady veterans,old ladies fight back,milwaukee carjacking,cut throat mob,cut throat carjackers,carjacking ring,milwaukee carjacking ring,miriam ben-shalom,karen weiss

item.title: Asian guy beats up white man after racial slurs: London student cleared of assault
item.description:
LONDON — A 20-year-old Asian man has been cleared of all charges in the aftermath of a racially-charged incident earlier this year. In March of 2016, Sidney Chan and a group of his friends were on their way home from a night on the town in London.
As they passed the Royal Albert Hall, a man started calling out racial slurs in their direction, telling them to “F--- off back to China,” among a handful of other unfriendly comments. The group of friends tried to steer clear of the man, named Stephen Kent, but he kept on coming, and started running toward them. Kent then grabbed a female in the group and started spouting sleazy comments at her.
Sidney Chan stepped in and pushed Kent off his friend, but Kent retaliated with a swing. At that point, to protect his friends from the violent man, Chan did what he had to do as a matter of self-defense. Kent ended up with a fractured nose, a fractured eye socket, and a heavy concussion, injuries he tried to make Chan pay for.
On Nov. 25, a jury unanimously found Chan not guilty of wounding with intent.
item.tags: video,Stephen Kent,sidney chan,imperial college union,royal albert hall,racism

item.title: Russian woman drops cellphone into vat of molten chocolate, dies trying to get it back
item.description:
FEDORTSOVO, RUSSIA — A worker at a Russian chocolate factory got a golden ticket to the afterlife when she fell into a vat of the sticky brown stuff and died.
Russian media reports said mom-of-two Svetlana Roslina dropped her cellphone into a vat of molten chocolate at the Sergiev-Posad confectionery factory in Fedortsovo, about 80 miles northeast of Moscow, the Telegraph reported.
The 24-year-old then tried to fish her phone out, but instead fell right into the thick choco gloop. Other reports said the woman was pouring flour into the mix when she fell in.
Regardless of the reason, Roslina wound up inside the container, and that was the end of the poor woman as she was minced alive by the vat’s mixers.
Following the incident, staff at the factory said that only Roslina’s legs remained. Local residents said they later saw a police car and a hearse driving into the factory.
The victim leaves behind a husband, Vladimir, and two young children.
Russian police were investigating, but this looks to us like a clear case of death by chocolate.
item.tags: video,Weird deaths,drowned in chocolate,drowning in chocolate,Sergiev Posad,Sergiev Posad chocolate,chocolate factory death

item.title: Muslim teen arrested for making up anti-Muslim attack
item.description:
NEW YORK CITY, NEW YORK — A Muslim woman who claimed she was victim of a hate crime by Trump supporters was arrested after she confessed that she made up the entire incident.
18-year-old Baruch College student Yasmin Seweid told New York police she was harassed by three white men shouting “Donald Trump’’ at the 23rd Street subway station on Dec. 1, New York Daily News reported.
Seweid’s said the men called her a “terrorist” and tried to pull off her hijab, while bystanders just watched. Seweid later posted about the experience on her Facebook account. She also claimed that a Trump America is real since she witnessed it herself.
Only problem was, Seweid made it all up. She had plenty of chances to tell the truth to the police as they devoted precious resources to investigating the incident
Doubts were raised when detectives failed to find witnesses or video of the incident. Suspicions surfaced when Seweid was reported missing last Thursday, then turned up safe at her sister’s place in Fishkill last Friday.
After again being questioned by detectives, Seweid confessed. She said she lied because she has issues with her strict Muslim parents over a Christian man she is seeing and she was out past her curfew drinking with friends.
Seweid’s parents allegedly shaved her hair off when they found out.
She was charged with filing a false report and released after she appeared early Thursday in Manhattan Criminal Court. She faces up to a year in jail
Seweid’s father, Syeed, an Egyptian immigrant, said he didn’t know why his daughter made up the story. He said: “She’s the one that can speak for herself.”
item.tags: video,Yasmin Seweid,false police report,Muslim hate crime,anti-Muslim,NYPD,trump supporters,discrimination,hate crime

item.title: Duterte killing drug dealers: Philippine president brags he has hunted, killed suspects
item.description:
MANILA, PHILIPPINES — On Monday, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte bragged that’d he has killed people during his tenure as mayor of Davao City.
He was speaking to business leaders at the presidential palace in Manila when he boasted, “In Davao I used to do it personally. Just to show the guys if I can do it, why can’t you?”, reported the BBC.
Duterte explained that he’d drive around the city on his big boy bike and would go on patrol. He also admitted “I was really looking for an encounter so I could kill,” reported CNN.
Since being voted in as president this summer, Duterte’s extrajudicial death squads have reportedly killed around 6,000 suspects during his bloody war on drugs.
item.tags: video,Facebook,mark zuckerberg,censorship,election 2016,donald trump,news censorship,fake news,fake news on facebook

item.title: RiverRide: Chicago may build floating, solar-powered bike path along Chicago River - TomoNews
item.description:
CHICAGO — Chicago may consider building a floating bike path along the edge of the Chicago River in an effort to become the most ‘bike-friendly city’ in the U.S.
Known as the RiverRide, the proposed bike path would float on the Chicago River between Horner and Ping Tom Parks, according to architecture firm Second Shore, which proposed the idea.
The bike path is built on steel-reinforced concrete pontoons, which are secured with pilings driven in the riverbed. Each 82-foot long by 12-foot wide segment is equipped with solar panels to generate power for lighting. More segments can be connected to extend the path.
The path is also embedded with a heating conduit to prevent icing on the surface. It also has retractable awnings that can roll out to shelter riders from rain and snow.
Each mile of the bike path might cost between $5 to $10 million. According to Co.Exist, Second Shore hopes a half mile of the bike path will be built in a pilot project by the summer of 2017.
item.tags: video,Second shore,riverride chicago,chicago bike path,chicago floating bike path,chicago solar powered bike path,chicago bike friendly,cycling,technology

item.title: Black gold: Largest oil deposit in the US discovered in West Texas, worth $900 billion - TomoNews
item.description:
MIDLAND, TEXAS — The largest oil deposit ever found in the U.S. was recently discovered in Texas’ Permian Basin.
The discovery was announced by the U.S. Geological Survey, which says the area reportedly contains an estimated 20 billion barrels of oil and 1.6 billion barrels of natural gas liquids.
With a barrel of oil priced at $45, according to West Texas Intermediate rates, the entire deposit could be worth around $900 billion.
The shale deposits were found in the basin’s Midland portion, in a section called Wolfcamp which already has more than 3,000 active oil wells.
Tapping into the deposits requires directional drilling, where the drill is turned horizontally at depth when it reaches the shale layer. Small fractures are created in the rock before fracking liquid is pumped in a high pressure to untap oil and gas deposits from the shale.
item.tags: video,Oil deposit,shale oil deposit,texas oil,texas oil deposit,permian basin,midland basin,wolfcamp,black gold,oil in america,us oil

item.title: Pneumatic waste disposal: Swedish company’s pneumatic vacuum tubes suck trash away - TomoNews
item.description:
STOCKHOLM — Swedish company Envac has designed an underground pipeline system that can collect trash by vacuum.
According to the company, the waste inlets can be located outdoors or indoors. When the waste is being thrown into the inlet, it will then slide down a pipe and enter a waste tank underground. The waste tank is emptied by a vacuum truck when it reaches its capacity.
The truck empties the tank via a docking point, which is often located outside residential areas. It has a vacuum system on board, which sucks the waste out of the tanks and into the truck, where it is compressed.
The waste collection system can be upgraded to include a pay-as-you-throw function that charges users on what they throw into the inlets.
The vacuum waste collection system was developed in the late 1980s. It has since been installed in countries such as Sweden, Denmark and Norway.
According to Waste360, Coney Island and a new development in Chelsea district in New York are considering installing the vacuum system.
item.tags: video,Envac,pneumatic vacuum tube,vacuum tube sucks trash away,mobile vacuum trash collection,envac vacuum trash collection,underground trash pipeline,technology

item.title: Uber flying cars: How Uber hopes to launch a fleet of self flying electric cabs by 2026 - TomoNews
item.description:
SAN FRANCISCO — Ride hailing company Uber released a white paper in October that envisions a future where commuters jetting city from to city in compact aircraft is as normal as taking the train.
Uber’s prediction of a world with commonplace urban air transit systems relies heavily on the widespread use of small self-flying electric aircraft with vertical takeoff and landing capability. Also known as VTOL, it is most commonly used by helicopters, as well as a small number of military aircraft.
According to the Uber white paper, a network of VTOL hubs or landing pads, dubbed “vertiports” and “vertistops”, could be used as terminals to ferry passengers. Unlike cars, buses and trains, VTOLs aren’t susceptible traffic jams or delays — they can fly from A to B with no fixed route. The company estimates the cost of a 15-minute flight may eventually reach as low as $21.
The aircraft would fly at cruise speeds of around 150 miles per hour and won’t go above 10,000 feet. The VTOL would be powered by rechargeable batteries that’d maintain 30-minutes of reserve energy.
Uber won’t manufacture the aircraft, but reckons the market will create them in the next five years, reported Wired, citing the white paper.
item.tags: video,Uber,The flying car,flying car,flying taxi,flying uber,vtol,uber vtol,uber vtol services,flying uber explained,urban air transport

item.title: Software on US Android phones secretly sent personal user information to China - TomoNews
item.description:
SHANGHAI — American security firm Kryptowire discovered preinstalled software on several Android phone models in the U.S. that secretly monitored its users.
The company stumbled upon the issue after noticing unusual network activity on a BLU R1 HD mobile phone owned by a researcher. According to the Kryptowire report, software on the device was found to be collecting message and call logs, contact lists, location information, and other personal data.
After encryption, the information was transmitted to four servers in Shanghai, later found to be registered to a Chinese company called Shanghai Adups Technology Co., Ltd. Data transmission occurred every 72 hours for message and call logs, and every 24 hours for other personally identifiable information.
Adups’ software was also capable of executing remote commands, including installing and updating applications on a phone. Anti-virus tools assumed the software was not malware since it came with the device, and were thus unable to detect its suspicious behavior.
Adups claims the software was designed to help a Chinese manufacturer monitor user behavior, but that it was never meant to be on American phones.
The full scope of the problem is still unclear, though 120,000 phones from American manufacturer BLU were among those affected.
item.tags: video,Android phone,android spyware,android malware,data leak,adups software,security risk,china spying,android backdoor,blu phones,blu security risk

item.title: Fake beard disguise: Florida gas station victimized by robber with magic marker beard
item.description:
HOLIDAY, FLORIDA — A robber hit up a gas station in Holiday, Florida with a disguise so effective the cops have no idea whether the criminal mastermind is a he or a she.
Instead of using a ski mask like a normal robber, this one simply used a magic marker to doodle on a fake beard before targeting the Holiday Gas Station around 8:30 p.m. on Wednesday.
Patch Media’s New Port Richey site reports that despite not having any sort of weapon, or even implying that there was one, the robber scared the gas station’s female clerk enough to get her to comply to demands.
After managing to get some cash, the genius robber fled the scene in a gray Toyota pickup truck.
Police are looking out for the fake-bearded suspect, but have yet to zero in on his or her identity. The culprit won’t be easy to spot, unless of course the facial hair was courtesy of a permanent pen.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Fake beard disguise,fake beard,robber disguise,magic marker beard,drawn on beard,sharpie beard,permanent marker,magic marker

item.title: Russia alcohol problem: 49 people die in Siberia after drinking bath liquid to get drunk
item.description:
IRKUTSK, RUSSIA — Dozens of people have died in the Siberian city of Irkutsk, and a bath liquid commonly used as a cheap alcohol substitute is to blame.
The liquid in question is reported to be a counterfeit version of a hawthorn-scented bath relaxant, which many Russians use to become inebriated. The bath liquid is less expensive than the cheapest vodka sold in Russia, making it an attractive alcoholic alternative for the poor. While it may be listed as 93 percent ethanol, tests reveal the liquid also contains methanol, a toxic ingredient in antifreeze that can be fatal if ingested.
Medical professionals estimate that as many as 12 million Russians consume alcoholic alternatives each year, which also include perfumes and window cleaners.
Authorities have detained seven people involved in the production of the substance and seized 2,000 bottles from stores.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Russia alcohol problem,russia alcoholism,russian alcoholics,alcoholics,alcohol,Bath liquid alcohol,Boyaryshnik,Hawthorn liquid,russian drunks

item.title: Celebrity sex robots: Realistic sex doll clones expected to be on the market soon
item.description:
’MURICA— Advances in robot technology will soon allow manufacturers to replicate the finer details of appearance and sound when it comes to creating dolls for sexual pleasure.
Sex doll engineers will be able to create robot clones by using photographs to copy eye colour, voice, dimensions and personality traits, the Daily Star reported.
The sex droids will have a lifelike pulse and warm skin, and advances in artificial intelligence could allow for the robots to sound like their real-life counterparts.
Celebrity A-listers are expected to have the luxury of licensing their likenesses to rake in even more cash. Unfortunately for the average person, there won’t be any way of preventing robotic clones from being produced. People will just have to accept that they may not own the rights to their appearance where robots are concerned.

item.title: Wedding disasters: Falling giant tree kills guest, crushes 5 others in California
item.description:
WHITTIER, CALIFORNIA — Disaster struck at a wedding in southern California on the weekend when a guest was crushed to death by a giant tree.
The wedding party was posing for a group shot at Penn Park in Whittier on Saturday when the 100-foot eucalyptus tree came crashing down on them, the Whittier Daily News reported.
As many as 20 guests were trapped underneath the tree, so the fire department used chainsaws to cut them out.
One of the guests, described as an older woman, died on her way to the hospital. Five other guests were injured, including a 4-year-old girl, but they’re all reportedly all right.
It’s unknown why the tree fell, but one theory is it could have been weakened by years of drought in California, which forced its thirsty roots above ground. Heavy rains last Friday night may then have loosened up the roots even further.
Witnesses said the tree split in two as it came crashing down to earth with a thunderous bang.
The traumatized wedding guests were offered counseling at the scene.
Authorities have been inspecting other trees in the park in case any more decide to come falling down.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Wedding disasters,wedding fails,tree falls on woman,tree falls on people,tree kills woman,crushed by tree,california drought

item.title: Diver found dead with throat slit and body tied to concrete pole off Thailand beach
item.description:
PATTAYA, THAILAND — Police in Thailand are investigating the death of an unidentified man, possibly a Russian national, who was found on Friday with his throat slit near the resort of Pattaya.
A jet-ski driver discovered the body tied to a concrete pole near Samae beach on the island of Koh Larn, a short boat ride from Pattaya. The victim was wearing a diver’s wetsuit and flippers, Asia One reported.
Police found a backpack strapped to the victim containing 1,500 Thai baht (about $42). The cops said the man was white, around 5 feet 6 inches tall, and between 45 and 50 years old.
As reported by the Bangkok Post, police divers found a snorkel, a cutter, a swimming cap, swimming goggles and other items from the seafloor near the concrete pole.
Police later questioned a fisherman and his wife. They also spoke with the owner of a resort on the beach on Sunday. None of them recognized the diver. However, the owner of a dive shop told police that the man looked like one of his clients.
Cops said on Thursday that witnesses heard the victim speaking Russian. The body has been transferred to Bangkok for an autopsy.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Tourists in thailand,tourist died in Thailand,tourist killed in Thailand,mystery murder,murder,samae beach,pattaya,koh larn

item.title: Uber driver shoots robber: Would-be robber shot dead by armed Uber driver in Florida
item.description:
AVENTURA, FLORIDA — An Uber driver turned the tables on an armed criminal, fighting back and possibly saving both his and his passenger’s lives.
WSVN reports that the driver had picked up the passenger from a condo in Aventura, Florida just before 6 a.m. on Sunday.
The two were on the William Lehman causeway en route to Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood Airport when a Dodge Caravan minivan carrying two people abruptly cut them off.
A man jumped out of the vehicle and aimed two guns at the Uber driver, demanding he hand over his belongings.
Instead, the driver pulled out his own weapon and fired shots at the suspect.
Seeing his accomplice dead, the minivan’s other passenger got behind the wheel and quickly drove away.
Police later located the vehicle, and are reportedly questioning a person of interest. Whether or not it’s one of the suspects is unclear.
The Uber driver was revealed to have a concealed carry permit, and will likely not be charged. His Uber driving days might be coming to an end though, since the ride-sharing app expressly prohibits drivers and riders from carrying firearms when in a vehicle.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Armed uber driver,uber driver shoots robber,florida robbery,uber robbery,uber attempted robbery,armed uber,aventura,concealed carry permit,2nd amendment rights

item.title: Snake eats dog: Python dies after being trapped in fence due to dog-sized stomach bulge
item.description:
WARRI, NIGERIA — Karma came swiftly for one voracious python, who got screwed over by his dinner and ended up dying for it.
Naij.com reports that after gorging itself on a whole canine, the six-foot-long reptile tried to slither out of a grassy lot in Warri, Nigeria. But halfway through, its doggie bump got wedged in between two iron rods and just wouldn’t budge.
With no way to squeeze itself out, the snake reportedly remained in the tight spot for several hours, and was dead by the time a local man discovered it.
Shocked at seeing such a huge animal, the man called a few more people to inspect slithers and make sure it had gone to serpent heaven.
The men freed the python and cut its stomach open to reveal the doggie dinner. They then built a fire and promptly burned the snake.
Photos of the snake were uploaded on Facebook back in July, but only recently went viral after being picked up by a number of news outlets.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Greedy python,python trapped in fence,trapped python,python eats dog,snake eats dog,python kills dog,snake kills dog,hungry snake,snake vs dog,snake attacks dog,snake attack,dead snake,dead python,snake swallows dog,python swallows dog

item.title: San Antonio cop shooting: police officer killed inside squad car while writing a ticket - TomoNews
item.description:
SAN ANTONIO — A Texas police officer was killed inside a squad car parked outside San Antonio police headquarters on Sunday.
Speaking at a news conference, Chief William McManus said Detective Benjamin Marconi was writing a ticket inside a police vehicle right before noon when the suspect’s car pulled up behind him. The suspect, described as a slim black man in his 20s or 30s, reportedly walked up to the driver’s side window and fired at Marconi, before reaching through the open window and opening fire again. Marconi was struck in the head and killed.
The suspect then reportedly walked back to his car, said to be a black Toyota or Nissan sedan with dark windows and chrome rims, and fled the scene through the police headquarters parking lot and from the west side of the building.
McManus compared the incident to to the recent deaths of police officers in Dallas and Baton Rouge, Louisiana. Both of those cases came after police were involved in the shootings of civilians that eventually sparked nationwide protests.
Police are still investigating the motive behind the San Antonio shooting.
Detective Marconi, 50, was a 20-year veteran of the force.
item.tags: video,San Antonio cop shooting,cop killer,man shoots cop in texas,cop killed by black man,gunman shoots at cops,texas shooting 2016

item.title: India train crash: 120 dead, 200 injured after Indore-Patna Express derails near Kanpur - TomoNews
item.description:
KANPUR, INDIA — Over a hundred people were killed, and many more injured in one of India’s worst train disasters in recent years.
The Times of India reports that the incident occurred early Sunday morning, when an overnight passenger train from Indore to Patna suddenly derailed in Pukhrayan, near the city of Kanpur.
The event took place at approximately 3 a.m., when most of the 500 passengers were asleep. A suspected rail fracture caused the train to jump off the tracks. People inside were jolted awake and reportedly violently flung around as the cars began to topple over.
Two sleeper cars also reportedly telescoped into each other and trapped those inside.
A total of 14 carriages were derailed, killing at least 120 people and injuring 200.
Rescuers have had difficulty cutting through the metal compartments. By Sunday afternoon, they were using heavy machinery to get survivors out.
India’s railway system is the fourth largest in the world, but it is also reportedly one of the most unsafe, with thousands dying in accidents, collisions, and derailments each year, according to Reuters.
item.tags: video,India train crash,india train accident,india train derailment,india train derail,train crash,train accident,india rail crash,india rail disaster,train derailment,train derail,train disaster,rail disaster

item.title: The democratic bubble: survey says left wing liberals more likely to unfriend opposers
item.description:
USA — A new poll by the Public Religion Research Institute reveals people’s political views have created serious division during the holiday season.
According to the poll, 28 percent of Democrats say they have blocked or unfriended someone on social media after viewing a post they disagreed with, compared to only 8 percent of conservatives who say they would do the same. Women surveyed were also twice as likely as men to unfriend someone, and 30 percent of female Democrats said they’d cut someone out for their political views, compared to just 14 percent of male Democrats.
Democrats were also five times more likely to actively avoid friends and family as a result of their politics than Republicans were, 10 percent vs. 2 percent. Most Democrats also take exception to those wishing others a “Merry Christmas.” The majority of Democrats surveyed would prefer the greeting more commonly used be “Happy Holidays!” On the other hand, 67 percent of Republicans responded that stores and businesses should continue on with “Merry Christmas.”
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Facebook,unfriending,democrats unfriend,PRRI,happy holidays,merry christmas,left wing,liberals

item.title: Koala covered in prickles gets a brush from a neighbor after escaping horny males
item.description:
APOLLO BAY, AUSTRALIA — When a koala ended up on a friendly man’s doorstep covered in prickles, he tried helping it in a variety of ways, until realizing all it needed was a good brush.
On the morning of December 17, Bruce Atkinson was on his way out the door to get breakfast. Standing on his front porch, he noticed a disheveled koala bear approaching him, covered in prickly burrs. Atkinson quickly tried to offer the koala a bowl of water, but the koala swiftly batted it away, as koalas get their water solely from eucalyptus leaves.
Bruce Atkinson then tried his best to clean her up a bit, grabbing a brush and brushing her from head to toe, a treatment she seemed to enjoy. Bruce Atkinson says a wildlife officer suggested the koala may have been trying to escape the advances of the males in the area, who tend to get a little bit frisky this time of year due to mating season.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Koala,cute koala,koala prickles,koala brush,koala mating,koala video,apollo bay

item.title: Anti porn bill: South Carolina pill seeks to filter out porn from devices sold in state
item.description:
COLUMBIA, SOUTH CAROLINA — State representatives Bill Chumley and Mike Burns are hell-bent on passing a bill that would make it harder and more expensive to access adult content online. Why? To combat human trafficking, they say.
The Spartanburg Herald Journal reports that under their Human Trafficking Prevention Act, all devices sold in South Carolina will need to be installed with a digital blocking system to filter out obscene content.
The proposed bill has a loophole though: Manufacturers or sellers could opt out if they fork over $20 per gadget.
Buyers who want the porn filters gone from their devices will also need to pay the same amount, on top of submitting a written request and proving they’re over 18.
All the money collected will supposedly go to the South Carolina attorney general’s human trafficking task force, as funding for anti-trafficking efforts.
The bill has already been referred to the South Carolina House Judiciary Committee and will be considered when the legislative session resumes in January.
As it is though, the bill will infringe on some pretty basic First Amendment rights, so who knows whether it will even get passed.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Human trafficking prevention act,Anti porn bill,south carolina bill,porn block,south carolina porn block,porn filter,bill chumley,mike burns,south carolina,anti human trafficking

item.title: Real-life Rapunzel from Russia has been growing her hair for 13 years
item.description:
BARNAUL, RUSSIA — A real-life Rapunzel’s fairytale length long locks have their roots in a teenage dare.
When Darya Gubanova Freckle was 14, she cut her knee-length braid. Two years later, a friend told her her hair would never be that long again. Darya set out prove her wrong. And did she ever. Thirteen years later, her hair is so long that people follow her on Instagram for it.
More than 209,000 people from all over the world, to be exact. Nicknamed the “Russian Rapunzel,” Darya hasn’t cut her hair since 2003 — and says she won’t until it reaches her feet, Metro reported.
It’s not easy having hair this long. Darya, who lives in Barnaul, in the Altai Krai region of Siberian Russia, uses up a 17-ounce shampoo bottle every two months and spends at least five minutes a day combing her luscious locks until they are silky smooth.
But she’s proud of how strangers react to her hair in public. Once, a woman with a cane chased her for three bus stops just so she could compliment Darya on her hair.
Now, the rest of her family is getting in on the trend. Her 6-year-old daughter is growing her hair out like her mother. Even Darya’s husband has started to let his hair grow out, although the family won’t say how long he wants his hair to be.
You can find out more about Darya and how she maintains her hair on her Instagram @DASHIK_GUBANOVA.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Rapunzel,Russian Rapunzel,real-life rapunzel,Darya Gubanova,Dashik Freckle,long hair,viral

item.title: Snake in Christmas tree: Aussie woman finds venomous tiger snake on her Christmas tree
item.description:
FRANKSTON, AUSTRALIA — Not even the holidays are safe from Mother Nature in Australia, as one woman realized after she found a slithery surprise waiting in her Christmas tree.
In a Facebook post by professional snake catcher Barry Goldsmith that has since gone viral, a one-meter long reptile was retrieved from Frankston, Melbourne residence, where it was peacefully nesting in the home’s Christmas tree.
The homeowner, a woman named Cheryl, spotted the deadly new Christmas decor one morning, which turned out to be a venomous tiger snake.
Notorious for their potentially fatal bites, tiger snakes are one of the most dangerous snakes in Australia, and are common during the summer.
Despite probably knowing all of this, the woman calmly holed herself up in a room before sending a photo of her guest to Goldsmith.
Twenty minutes later, the tiger snake was in a bag, and Christmas was back to normal.
Goldsmith said the snake was eventually released back into the bush, far from humans and other Christmas trees.
Netizens were confused as to how a live snake could get itself onto a plastic Christmas tree, to which Goldsmith replied that the reptile most likely slithered in through an open door.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Christmas tree snake,snake in christmas tree,tiger snake,australia tiger snake,snake in tree,australia christmas,venomous snakes

item.title: Uber driver attacks passenger: Cabbie stabs passenger five times for tapping window
item.description:
BLOOMFIELD TOWNSHIP, MICHIGAN — An Uber driver is in jail this week after he allegedly stabbed a passenger five times for tapping on his car window.
According to a Bloomfield Township police report posted by ClickOnDetroit, Jacob Matthew Allemon, aged 23, picked up a couple from a holiday party in Bloomfield, Michigan early Saturday morning.
The man tapped on Allemon’s window to let them know they were coming into his car. Police say Allemon felt this action was disrespectful to his vehicle.
He drove them for around a mile, then stopped at a parking lot and told them to get out. The couple asked if they could wait for another ride, since they were in the middle of a snowstorm.
Instead, Allemon started fighting with the man. He reportedly stabbed him five times in his face, chest and neck, but, amazingly the 49-year-old victim managed to disarm and restrain him until a nearby police officer arrived.
According to the Detroit Free Press, the victim was treated at a hospital and released the following day.
Allemon, meanwhile, was charged with assault and is being held on $250,000 bond. Uber banned him from the ride-hailing app and described the incident as “appalling.”
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Uber driver attacks passenger,uber driver,uber,bloomfield township,michigan,jacob allemon,jacob matthew allemon,uber stab attack

item.title: Bungee jump gone wrong: Brazilian man dives head-first into the ground in fatal jump
item.description:
SÃO PAULO — The shocking moment that a Brazilian thrill-seeker died in front of his family in a bungee jump gone horribly wrong has been captured on video.
The incident happened on Sunday in São Paulo state, when Fabio Ezequiel de Moraes, 36, thought it would be a good idea to jump off a 130-foot high railway bridge with an elastic cord tied around his ankle.
The only problem with that was nobody had checked to see if the cord was too long.
Moraes slammed head-first into the ground, the Sun reported, citing Brazilian newspaper Reporter Diario.
First responders arrived on the scene and rushed Moraes to the hospital but the head trauma proved too great, and he died soon afterward.
Things could have been a lot worse, though. Moraes originally planned to jump with his 6-year-old son, but decided at the last minute that he would do it solo.
Sadly however, the poor boy witnessed his father’s tragic death. Moraes’ horrified wife, brother, and his brother’s girlfriend also watched the fatal bungee jump.
Moraes hired a team of extreme sports specialists to help him do the jump. Police seized the team’s equipment and were investigating Moraes’ death.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,bungee jump gone wrong,bungee jump fail,bungee jump accident,bungee jumping fails,man dies bungee jumping,bungee jump

item.title: Great white shark: Fisherman hooks mammoth 3,000-pound shark off South Carolina
item.description:
HILTON HEAD, SOUTH CAROLINA — A fisherman who routinely catches and releases sharks had the experience of a lifetime after hooking not one, but two of the great predators in a single day.
The Island Packet reports that after setting off near the Hilton Head coast in South Carolina on Tuesday, Captain Chip Michalove and his two-person crew hooked a female great white shark weighing an estimated 3,000 pounds. Before they could catch the mammoth shark, however, it spit out the hook and swam away.
According to his Facebook post, Michalove was disappointed and nearly called it a day, but decided to give it another shot after a short rest.
Another great white, this time male, soon came biting; and though not as massive as the first one, was still relatively large at nine and a half feet long.
After a bit of a struggle, the crew finally caught the shark, put an acoustic tag on him, and sent him on his merry way.
Tags typically stay on for seven years, and provide scientists with helpful data to study and protect the majestic predators.
All in all, it was a very productive day for Michalove and his crew. Still, the fisherman can’t help but pine for the one that got away.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Great white shark,shark tagging,shark catch and release,catch and release,sport fishing,shark,3,000 pound great white,great white,chip michalove

item.title: Teacher disciplined after posing inappropriate algebra question to students
item.description:
MIDDLEBURG HEIGHTS, OHIO — A math teacher at Middleburg Heights Junior High School outside Cleveland has been disciplined for showing his students a naughty algebra question.
Teacher Daniel Rapp got in trouble after one of his students snapped a photo of a sexting-related math problem displayed on their classroom’s projector screen.
The question: Tony can send five texts and three nude selfies in 19 minutes. He can also send three texts and one nude in nine minutes. How long would it take Tony to send one text and one nude selfie?
The father of two 14-year-old students told local Fox affiliate WJW he was “appalled” by the question and had filed a formal complaint.
The school’s superintendent told the station that Mr. Rapp had been reprimanded for the inappropriate question but will remain in the classroom. The school would not give the station Mr. Rapp’s file, but the superintendent did say a “similar reprimand” was already in the teacher’s file.
In case you’re wondering, the answer to the question is it would take Tony five minutes to send one text and one nude.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Math,naughty math problems,teacher,math teacher disciplined,inappropriate math problem

item.title: Chargers security guard caught red-handed making self love in front of cheerleaders
item.description:
A security guard at an NFL game has been caught on camera doing what looks like the five-finger knuckle shuffle — just feet away from dancing cheerleaders.
The footage of the out-of-bounds behavior was filmed by a dumbfounded fan at the Qualcomm Stadium in San Diego on Sunday before the Chargers played the Oakland Raiders.
It seems the sight of the cheerleaders going through their pre-game dance routines was enough to trigger a solo raid inside the guard’s pants as the young man charged it to the home team in front of a 68,000-person crowd.
One shocked fan thought she was going to watch a game of football, but started filming when instead she saw the guard playing pocket billiards.
The fan uploaded the video to social media and wrote that she was disgusted. She said she couldn’t believe the security guard had gotten away with such a complete disregard for public decency and was horrified by the man’s lack of respect for women’s rights.
The video quickly went viral, and came to the attention of the guard’s employers, Elite Security. The guard was fired within hours, TMZ reported.
The San Diego Police Department has opened an investigation, according to TMZ.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Chargers security guard,caught on camera,caught on tape,self love,chargers guard caught on camera,chargers security guard video

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Morgan Freeman-voiced Jarvis AI: Facebook CEO created his own Iron Man-like AI
item.description:
PALO ALTO, CALIFORNIA — Mark Zuckerberg decided to build himself a personal AI assistant, inspired by Tony Stark’s Jarvis, and guess what? It’s called Jarvis.
But rather than have the Iron Man actor Paul Bettany voice the system, Zuckerberg asked Morgan Freeman to do it instead, Fast Company reported.
Through his very-own iOS app, the Facebook CEO can talk to Jarvis when he wakes up and have him turn the lights on and off as well as open the curtains.
Jarvis can also help Mark get dressed in the morning by way of a clothes cannon.
The system is able to entertain his daughter Max, as well as teach her Mandarin lessons.
And if anyone’s hungry for toast, Jarvis can take care of that as well.
The AI butler is also designed to automatically open their front gate for family and friends.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Mark Zuckerberg,Mark Zuckerberg Jarvis AI,Mark Zuckerberg Morgan Freeman AI,Mark Zuckerberg Jarvis,Iron Man Jarvis

item.title: Wedding proposal: Woman’s priceless reaction to same-sex proposal goes viral
item.description:
CHICAGO — An adorable old lady melted the internet’s frigid heart with her delightfully candid reaction to a woman proposing to another woman.
Jess Rodriguez planned a public proposal for long-term girlfriend Chelsea Miller at the Art Institute of Chicago, which one unsuspecting museum-goer who had front row seats to.
The romantic proposal thrilled the older woman, who was snapped with a look of pure joy and excitement on her face.
Rodriguez and her fiancee didn’t even notice the lady’s reaction firsthand, only spotting it in the engagement photo later on.
Her brother put up the heartwarming scene on Twitter, where it soon went viral and made most netizens collectively melt into a puddle of goo.
Rodriguez has since announced on social media that the couple chose June 30, 2018 as their wedding date.

item.title: Stolen breast milk: Hong Kong man steals breast milk from office fridge, sends NSFW pic
item.description:
SAI WAN HO, HONG KONG — A man who stole breast milk from his office pantry and sent inappropriate text messages to the woman whose milk it was has pleaded guilty to theft, on account of stress.
On March 8, Lam Chung-kan decided to hit the office pantry to grab a refreshing beverage. Oddly, he chose to take a bottle of breast milk from the fridge.
His colleague, the owner of the breast milk, began receiving text messages from an unknown caller who claimed of having drank the baby formula. A month later, more odd text messages came in – one photo of a glass of milk, and the other, of an erect penis wrapped in a plastic bag.
Caught on CCTV camera footage in the office, 37-year-old Lam pleaded guilty to one count of theft, for which he’ll have to pay for with 200 hours of community service. Lam’s lawyer insisted her client is not mentally ill, but instead chose to steal the breast milk as a means of coping with stress.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Man steals breast milk,breast milk,Lam Chung-kan,upskirt,perv

item.title: Dog strangled to death with leash trapped between elevator doors
item.description:
CHANGZHOU CITY, CHINA — We all know that elevators in China like to eat people. But apparently they like to eat dogs, too.
As reported by the Changzhou Daily Post, this unfortunate incident happened in Jiangsu Province when a dog’s owner went up in an elevator without him.
In surveillance footage obtained by the newspaper, an 80-year-old woman can be seen walking her dog to an apartment elevator in Yuhewan district of Changzhou City around p.m. on Dec. 6.
But when they got into the elevator, the dog turned around and and walked out. The elevator’s doors then closed and the elevator began its ascent. The old woman pushed the alarm button for help, but to no avail.
Technicians came to open the elevator doors, but the dog was dead. The woman was physically unharmed but emotionally scarred for the rest of her life.
Local police told the newspaper that small or thin objects like leashes and dogs are difficult for elevators to detect. When a group of people enter an elevator, it is best to press and hold the open button until the entire group is inside.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Strangled to death,dogs strangled to death,elevator death,elevator accidents,dogs and elevator

item.title: Adult entertainer Nikki Benz alleges director choked and stomped her in attack on set
item.description:
LOS ANGELES — One of the world’s most well-known adult entertainers has accused a director of attacking her on set during a film shoot.
Actress Nikki Benz took to Twitter on Tuesday to allege that director Tony T choked her and stomped on her head in a vicious attack.
Benz wrote that in all of her 13 years working in the adult entertainment industry it was the first time she had gone into shock and cried on set.
The fallout from the incident has seen the star become embroiled in a furious row with the movie’s producers, Canadian website Brazzers.
Benz wrote on Twitter that she told Brazzers she did not want the scene to be released and accused the company of pressuring her to say everything was OK so that she would receive her paycheck.
Brazzers denied responsibility for the alleged attack and described the director as a third party.
However, several other adult stars have leapt to Benz’s defense. Some actresses said the alleged attack was not an isolated incident, while others reported they had also had bad experiences with Tony T in the past.
Jenna Jameson, arguably the world’s most famous adult film star, offered her support to Benz. Jameson told Fox News that producers like Brazzers were making money from rape scenes and it was time to call them out on it.
No criminal charges have been filed against Tony T.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Nikki benz,nikki benz attack,brazzers,porn star,porn star attacked,nikki benz attacked,jenna jameson,porn star assault

item.title: Florida cops grab suspect by dreadlocks, share shaming photos on Facebook and Twitter - TomoNews
item.description:
PASCO COUNTY, FLORIDA — A sheriff’s office is facing a backlash after it posted a photo of two deputies gripping a crying suspect by his hair to social media.
The Pasco County Sheriff’s Office labelled suspect Marquis Porter, 21, their “Sad Criminal of the Day” following his arrest last week.
Porter was arrested on Nov. 17 after he fled a traffic stop and then intentionally ran a deputy off the road, the sheriff’s office posted to Facebook and Twitter.
Porter was found with multiple drugs in his possession, including 9.5 grams of crystal meth, according to the cops.
Following his arrest, two deputies grabbed a handcuffed and crying Porter by his dreadlocks and paraded him in front of a camera.
The Pasco County Sheriff’s Office shared the photo to its social media accounts but later deleted the Facebook post following a barrage of criticism. The post remains on Twitter.
In response, the sheriff’s office posted a grainy video to Twitter, which they said shows compassionate deputies giving Porter a blanket and water following his arrest.
The sheriff’s office defended the original photo, saying it posted pictures of criminals online every day as a service to the community, the Tampa Bay Times reported.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Social media shaming,pasco county sheriff,marquis porter,cops grab dreadlocks,cops grab hair,cops vs criminals,dumb florida

item.title: Ivanka Trump confronted by angry passenger on JetBlue flight who brags about it
item.description:
NEW YORK — A JetBlue passenger was removed from his flight along with his husband and their child after a confrontation with Ivanka Trump last Thursday.
Passenger Marc Scheff told Reuters that when fellow passenger Dan Goldstein saw Ivanka and her family in the economy section of the New York to San Francisco flight on Thursday, he did a double take and said: “Oh my God. This is a nightmare!”
Goldstein, a 35-year-old attorney from Brooklyn, continued his rant, saying: “Why is she on our flight? She should be flying private.” Meanwhile, Goldstein’s husband Matthew Lasner, a professor at New York’s Hunter College, tweeted on his twitter @MattLasner that his husband was going to harass Ivanka’s husband Jared Kushner, adding the hashtag #banalityofevil.
The plane was still boarding when the incident occurred, and JetBlue’s cabin crew was able to escort Goldstein, Lasner and their child off the flight.
Scheff told CNN he overheard Ivanka tell JetBlue staff, “I don't want to make this a thing.” Scheff said it seemed like Ivanka was fine with letting her harasser stay on the plane.
When JetBlue staff approached Goldstein to “make sure he was calm,” he said: “They ruin our country, now try (to) ruin our flight!” As Goldstein and his family were being escorted off the plane, he could be heard asking: “You're kicking me off for expressing my opinion?!”
The couple were put on the next flight. Lasner defended his husband by tweeting: “My husband expressed his displeasure in a calm tone, JetBlue staff overheard, and they kicked us off.”
Responding to the incident on Fox News, a Trump spokesman said: “To do that to a woman who was on there with her children, I don’t care what your political background is or what your thoughts are, that’s not the way we as Americans need to act.”
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Ivanka Trump,Dan Goldstein,Matthew Lasner,Donald Trump,airplane harassment,public harassment

item.title: Robot boyfriend: French woman wants to marry her 3D-printed robot lover
item.description:
PARIS — A French woman has built her own robot lover and she plans to marry him.
As a child, Lilly said she loved robot’s voices. When she was 19, she realized she was “robosexual,” meaning she is only attracted to robots.
“My only two relationships with men have confirmed my love orientation, because I dislike really physical contact with human flesh,” Lilly told News.com.au.
Lilly built her robot lover, which she named Inmmovator, by 3D printing. She has lived with him for one year and the happy couple plans to marry when robot-human marriage is legalised in France.
Lilly did not reveal whether she is having a sexual relationship with her robot lover but she is training to become a roboticist to further her passion in the field of robots.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,French woman wants to marry robot,french woman robot relationship,robot lover,human-robot marriage,lilly French woman marries robot,technology

item.title: Bizarre deep sea creatures: Pictures of Russian fisherman’s catch go viral
item.description:
MURMANSK, RUSSIA — Startling images of strange deep sea creatures are going viral, thanks to one Russian fisherman and his Twitter account, which the English-language Moscow Times discovered for a global audience.
His name is Roman Fedorstov and he crews a deep sea trawler based out of Murmansk in Russia’s frigid far northwest.
Fedorov has been cataloguing the strange finds his trawler pulls from the deep ocean, including the hellish Pacific angelfish and the frill shark, which lives up to 5,000 feet beneath the waves. Most of this stuff isn’t intentionally harvested, but turns up in the trawling nets anyhow — this known as “by-catch.”
His Twitter feed, which catalogues dozens of incredible images, now has a healthy 83,000 followers.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Deep sea,deep sea fish,deep ocean,Murmansk,Russia,Roman Fedorstov,fishing

item.title: Carrie Fisher dead at 60: Famed Star Wars actress dies following heart attack on plane
item.description:
LOS ANGELES — Yet another star has gone out in the sky during the waning moments of 2016. Actress Carrie Fisher, famous for her iconic portrayal of Princess Leia in the Star Wars universe has passed away at the age of 60.
On a flight from London on Dec. 23, Fisher went into a bout of cardiac arrest just 15 minutes before landing in Los Angeles. A doctor and nurse on board the flight rushed to her aid, as EMTs on the ground stormed in to carry her off.
After being taken to hospital and treated, the entire internet breathed a huge sigh of relief on Christmas Day when reports indicated she was in stable condition. However, a mere two days later, Fisher was reported dead.
Carrie Fisher now joins David Bowie, Prince, Muhammad Ali, George Michael, and too many more on the tragic list of legends we lost this year.
While fans mourn her loss, we are also left to wonder what will become of Princess Leia in future installments of the Star Wars saga. Shooting for Episode VIII wrapped in July, but with Leia said to play an integral role in Episode IX, mystery will now consume the future of the franchise.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Carrie fisher,princess leia,star wars,episode VIII,star wars episode 8,episode 8,episode 9,star wars princess leia,episode IX,star wars episode 9,celebrity deaths 2016,2016 celebrity deaths

item.title: Abandoned cat’s matted fur grows into outrageous 2-pound dreadlocks
item.description:
PITTSBURGH — A cat who’d been neglected by her owner with Alzheimer’s disease was found with fur matted so badly it had become dreadlocks.
On December 16, the Animal Rescue League Shelter in Pittsburgh posted these outrageous photographs to Facebook of a cat in desperate need of a cut. The cat’s elderly owner had Alzheimer’s disease, and last week, his family had him moved to a nursing home, deeming him unable to safely care for himself. Unfortunately, he forgot his two pet cats behind.
Paul Russel, a distant relative of the elderly man, showed up to leave some food out for the one cat he knew about. Walking around the house, he saw something raggedy bolt out from under the bed, and down to the cellar. Using a flashlight, Russel searched around until he spotted a cat, covered in matted fur that weighed in at roughly 2 pounds.
When Paul Russel brought the cat into the vet, they anesthetized her so the long overdue fur-cut could finally commence. Now freed of her unwanted fur coat, the cat, whose name is Hidey, now has a new home with the man who saved her.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Cat dreadlocks,rasta cat,reggae,bong hits,dreadlocks,hidey the cat

item.title: Teenager falls to his death trying to sled down snow-covered waterslide
item.description:
WISCONSIN DELLS, WISCONSIN — A teenager from Florida fell to his death on Wednesday after attempting to sled down a snow-covered waterslide at a Wisconsin theme park.
Addison Williams, 16, was sledding on some hills with his brother and a friend, when the trio decided it was a good idea to hop a 7-foot high fence into a closed area of the Mount Olympus Water and Theme Park in Wisconsin Dells.
Williams raced down a waterslide on his sled but got stuck in the snow about halfway down, NBC-affiliate WTMJ reported. Williams tried to free himself but instead fell 35 feet to the ground, police said.
A paramedic was driving by at the time and jumped over the fence with a defibrillator, but was unable to revive the boy.
Police said Williams and his family from Port St Lucie, Florida were guests at the theme park and had traveled to Wisconsin to experience snow for the first time. A GoFundMe page has been set up to help the family with funeral expenses.
Authorities are investigating the incident but the Mount Olympus Park is not suspected of being at fault.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Sledding gone wrong,boy falls off waterslide,falling to death,mount olympus water slides,boy falls off waterslide,sledding fails

item.title: Pet owner slits throat of pit bull that mauled his poodle to death
item.description:
RIVERSIDE, CALIFORNIA — A pet owner was arrested on animal cruelty charges for killing a pit bull that mauled his dog to death over the weekend.
Rudy Jesus Barajas, 30, cut the pit bull’s throat after the dog took the life of his pet, a 10-month-old poodle mix named Spunky, CBSLA reported.
The incident took place on Saturday morning, when a neighbor’s 2-year-old pit bull ran into Barajas’ property and went straight for Spunky.
Barajas and other neighbors tried to stop the attack, but they were too late, as the pit bull had already clamped down on the poodle’s neck.
After the pit bull let go, Barajas grabbed the dog by its neck, dragged it into his kitchen and slit its throat with a knife.
The pit bull ran back across the street to its owner and collapsed. It died on the way to the animal hospital.
Some witnesses said the pit bull tried to bite people at the scene after it let go of the poodle, according to the Press Enterprise.
But according to the Riverside County Animal Services, Barajas acted out of spite when he killed the dog. The police are investigating and Barajas could face felony animal cruelty charges.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Pitbull,pitbull attack,killer pitbulls,man slits pitbull throat,man cuts pitbulls throat,pitbull dog,dangerous pitbull dogs

item.title: Ohio State attack: Somali muslim refugee stabs 11 people then gets killed by hero cop
item.description:
COLUMBUS, OHIO — Nearly a dozen people were left wounded following a knife attack at Ohio State University on Monday morning.
Abdul Razak Ali Artan began his stabbing spree by driving his car onto the sidewalk and running over pedestrians, the Columbus Dispatch reported.
The incident took place near Watts Hall on the university campus.
Artan, an 18-year-old student at the university, then exited the vehicle and began attacking people with a butcher knife, WBNS-10TV reported. He injured 11 people in his attack, including one critically.
Officer Alan Horujko of the Ohio State University police confronted Artan and ordered him to drop his weapon. Artan did not comply, prompting Horujko to open fire and kill him.
According to the Cleveland Plain Dealer, Artan was a Somalian Muslim refugee with permanent residence status who came to the U.S. in 2014. He graduated cum laude from Columbus State Community College before enrolling at Ohio State.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Ohio state attack,ohio state isis,ohio state knife man,abdul razak ali artan,ohio state university,stabbing,columbus,campus attack

item.title: Man gets thrown from helicopter: Duterte says he threw a kidnapper out a helicopter
item.description:
MANILA — Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte this week claimed he once threw a kidnapper out a helicopter when he was mayor of Davao city.
That man and his cohorts had reportedly kidnapped and abused a Chinese girl.
Duterte’s claims were made as he threatened to do the very same thing to corrupt officials over the city of Manila, reported The Philippine Star.
Earlier this month he admitted to hunting and killing suspects while he was mayor of Davao.
Nearly 6,000 drugs suspects have been extrajudicially killed by police under orders from Duterte since he became president in the summer.
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,Man gets thrown from helicopter,Duterte,rodrigo duterte,Helicopter death,rodrigo duterte vs drug dealers,duterte vigilante,duterte kills people,davao city,philipines,manila

item.title: DUI: California man charged with DUI for driving under the influence of caffeine
item.description:
SOLANO COUNTY, CALIFORNIA — A California man charged in 2015 with driving under the influence of a drug says he wants to clear his name after blood tests revealed caffeine but no sign of any drugs.
On Aug. 5 of that year, Joseph Schwab, 36, was driving home from work in Solano County when he was pulled over by a police officer in an unmarked car, the Guardian reported.
According to the police officer, Schwab was driving erratically and had cut her off. Although Schwab blew a 0.00% blood alcohol level on a breathalyzer test, he was was booked into the county jail and had his blood drawn for further testing.
The toxicology report showed that Schwab was negative for benzodiazepines, cocaine, opiates, THC, carisoprodol, methamphetamine, oxycodone and zolpidem.
According to documents provided to the Guardian, a second test was conducted in a Pennsylvania lab. The test showed that Schwab did indeed have a chemical in his system — caffeine.
Schwab later filed a motion to get the case dismissed, but the motion was denied. Now Schwab plans to take the case to court on Jan. 11.
According to Sharon Henry, chief deputy district attorney for Solano County, her office was still investing the matter. She said “the charge of driving under the influence is not based upon the presence of caffeine in his system.”
item.tags: video,animation,NAS,Next Animation Studio,DUI,police arrest,caffeine,police arrest,driving under influence of caffeine,Joseph Schwab,Solano County

item.title: Seal waddles into Aussie suburb and jumps on some cars
item.description:
NEWSTEAD, AUSTRALIA — One Australian town got a late Christmas surprise on Boxing Day morning when a 200-kg fur seal waddled into town.
According to Australian broadcaster ABC, the creature jumped on two cars before being tranquilized by police on the island of Tasmania.
Dubbed “Lou-Seal” by officers, the large male mammal will be released after a medical check-up, Tasmanian police said in a Facebook post.
